WebMatrix Helpers

Windows Azure Storage Helper - Start Here

Introduction

Microsoft WebMatrix provides an easy way to get started with web development, and together with new Razor syntax for ASP.NET Web Pages it includes everything you need to get your web site up, running and integrated with many other sites and networks, in a short period of time. The WebMatrix helpers are designed to make your life easier when creating web sites. They provide you a simple and consistent way of performing common web development tasks that otherwise would require a great deal of custom coding. With a few lines of code you should be able to secure your web site using membership, store information in Windows Azure Storage, integrate your site with Facebook, among others things.

Windows Azure storage services provide persistent, redundant storage in the cloud. The Windows Azure Storage helper, allows you to easily retrieve and insert data into Blobs and Tables of Windows Azure Storage Services. For more information on Windows Azure check: http://www.microsoft.com/windowsazure/

Getting Started in 60 Seconds

The helper consists mainly of a Microsoft.Web.Helpers.WindowsAzureStorage.dll library located into the Bin folder of your WebMatrix site. To use the Windows Azure Storage helper follow these steps:

  1. If you haven’t already got one, sign up for a Windows Azure account in the Windows Azure Home Page.
  2. Then provide your set of Windows Azure Storage Credentials, by adding the following lines in your _AppStart.cshtml WebMatrix page.
    @{
    WindowsAzureStorage.AccountName = "yourAccountName";
    WindowsAzureStorage.AccountKey = "yourAccountKey";
    }
  3. Start using Windows Azure Storage Tables and Blobs from WebMatrix with the Helper. Check the samples!

Running the Samples

The helper package includes a set of WebMatrix pages where you can see the helper in action. To run them follow these steps:

  1. Provide your set of Windows Azure Storage Credentials, by uncommenting (or adding) the following lines in the _AppStart.cshtml WebMatrix page.
    @{
    WindowsAzureStorage.AccountName = "yourAccountName";
    WindowsAzureStorage.AccountKey = "yourAccountKey";
    }
  2. In Microsoft WebMatrix, under the Files workspace, right-click the WindowsAzureStorage\SampleApp folder and select 'Launch in browser'. This will open the sample web site with WebMatrix.
  3. Play with the samples!

More Info

To explore the helper's implementation you can download its source code from the Windows Azure Storage Helper CodePlex project; you will also find unit tests for the helpers methods.

Learn more on WebMatrix, ASP.NET Web Pages and the Razor Syntax with the WebMatrix tutorials.
